questions.instruction: Read the short biography of Michael Jackson and do the tasks given.
questions.passage: Michael Jackson was born on August 29, 1958, in Gary, Indiana. He was the eighth child of the Jackson family. He began his music career at the age of five as a member of the Jackson 5. He became a global pop icon with albums like 'Thriller' and 'Bad'. He was known as the 'King of Pop'. He died on June 25, 2009, in Los Angeles.

tasks.instruction: Fill in the gaps with correct words or phrases from the box below.

questions.instruction: Read the following advertisement and do the schedules that follow.
questions.advertisement:
WANTED: Transmission Line Engineer
Qualification: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering
Experience: At least 2 years
Salary: Negotiable
Location: Kathmandu
Apply within 10 days to: principal@abcdschool.edu.np

schedules.question: Mention all the documents to be submitted along with the application.
What are the two required experiences that a candidate needs?
Who will be called for the final selection?

questions.instruction: Write a readable story in about 200 words using the points given below.
points: Once upon a time, there was a poor woodcutter.
He worked hard every day to feed his family.
One day, he found a magic lamp in the forest.
He rubbed it and a genie appeared.
He asked for wealth and happiness.

questions.instruction: Write True for the true statements and False for the false ones.
statements: The sun rises in the west.
Water boils at 100°C at sea level.
The Ganga river flows through Nepal.

questions.instruction: Read the following excerpt of a letter and do the tasks that follow.
questions.excerpt:
Dear Sita,
I am very happy to receive your letter. It has been long since we met. I am fine and hope you are well too. I have passed my SEE examination with good grades. I want to study science in the higher level. How about you? What are your plans?
Yours lovingly,
Gita

tasks.instruction: What does the speaker advise people to do in the last stanza?

questions.instruction: Read the following poem and answer the questions.
questions.poem: Leave this chanting and singing and telling of beads! / Open your eyes and see thy God is not before thee!

questions.question: What is the main theme of the poem?
Where is the speaker asking the listener to look?
Why is being addressed in the poem?
